meanings.definition: To sell for less than the actual value.
meanings.sent1: The store undersells its products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She always undersells her old clothes at the garage sale.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky salesman undersells the quality of the items to make them seem like a bargain.
meanings.sent4: His modesty undersells his true talent as an artist.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement undersells the beauty of the vacation destination.

meanings.definition: To present as less important or impressive than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The student undersells his achievements to avoid attention.
meanings.sent2: The company undersells the benefits of their new product in the marketing campaign.
meanings.sent3: She always undersells her cooking skills, but everyone loves her dishes.
meanings.sent4: The movie trailer undersells the excitement of the actual film.
meanings.sent5: His speech undersells the impact of his groundbreaking research.
